intro: Tibouchina xochiatencana, commonly known as Mexican beauty or Mexican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a glossy texture, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. Tibouchina xochiatencana is well-suited for tropical and subtropical climates, making it a popular ornamental plant.
